page.title: 04Michaelston Church cont.
page.content: The dominating feature of the interior is the wooden three-decker pulpit, one among only three in Wales. The Clerk's desk, lectern and pulpit can be found on these three levels. Across the aisle stands the box pew of the local wealthy Cwrt-yr-ala family, whose home still dominates the surrounding countryside. One of the most unusual features of this church is that the pews are fixed such that the congregation sit with their backs to the altar. On either side of the altar, oak chairs carved with scenes from the Civil War are a reminder that the parish was one of the prizes awarded to Colonel Horton's victorious brigade after the Battle of St Fagans in 1648. However, it escaped Cromwell's reform of the established church.
